hint: A common red or green fruit.
A long, curved yellow fruit.
A small, round fruit often found in bunches.
A white, nutritious liquid produced by mammals.
A staple food made from flour and water, often baked.
A piece of furniture for sitting on, typically with a back and four legs.
A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, used for eating or working.
A piece of furniture for sleeping on.
A device for giving light.
An eating utensil with a small, shallow bowl at the end of a handle.
An eating utensil with two or more tines.
A cutting tool with a blade and a handle.
A small, open container typically used for drinking.
A flat dish from which food is eaten or served.
An electronic device for viewing broadcasts.
A device used for voice communication over long distances.
An electronic device for processing data.
A set of written or printed pages fastened together along one side.
A writing or drawing implement with a graphite stick.
Material manufactured in thin sheets from pulp, used for writing, printing, or packaging.
A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an engine, and able to carry a small number of people.
A large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road.
A bicycle, a two-wheeled vehicle propelled by pedals.
A round object that can be thrown, kicked, or hit in a game.
A small model of a human figure, used as a toy.
A large, heavy road vehicle for carrying goods.
A small, domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractile claws.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and a barking or howling voice.
A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate distinguished by the possession of feathers, wings, a beak, and typically by being able to fly.
A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water.
The part of a plant that blossoms, often colorful and fragrant.
A woody perennial plant, typically with a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground.
The star that the Earth orbits, providing light and heat.
The natural satellite of the Earth, visible by reflected sunlight.
A large, glowing ball of gas in space.
A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere.
Water falling in drops from the atmosphere.
An item of footwear worn on the foot.
A garment for the upper body.
An outer garment covering the body from the waist to the ankles, with a separate part for each leg.
A garment worn on the foot, covering the ankle and lower part of the leg.
A covering for the head.
An outer garment with sleeves, worn on the upper body, typically extending below the hips.
A movable barrier in a wall or opening for entering or exiting.
An opening in a wall or vehicle that allows light and air to enter.
The lower surface of a room, on which one stands.
A continuous vertical brick or stone structure that encloses or divides an area of land.
The upper covering of a building.
A common green plant covering much of the Earth's land surface.
A clear, odorless, tasteless liquid essential for life.
Rapid combustion of substances, producing heat and light.
The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the Earth.
An object for children to play with.
An activity engaged in for amusement or competition.
Engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation.

Move rhythmically to music.
Interpret and understand written material.
Mark symbols on a surface, typically paper, to record information.
Produce a picture or diagram by making lines and marks.
A natural state of rest for the body and mind.
Put food into the mouth and chew and swallow it.
Take a liquid into the mouth and swallow.
Move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn.
Move at a speed faster than a walk.
Push oneself off a surface into the air.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
Feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy.
Of considerable size or extent.
Of a size that is less than normal or usual.
Having a high temperature.
Having a low temperature.
Towards a higher place or position.
Towards a lower place or position.
Expressing the situation of something that is or appears to be enclosed or surrounded by something else.
Moving or appearing to move away from a particular place, especially one that is enclosed or in a confined space.

Away from the place in question; to or at a distance.
Move from one place to another.
Come to an end or cause to come to an end.
A greeting.

A negative response.

Feeling distress, especially for something wrong done.

A shop.

A person who is studying at a school or college.
Acquire knowledge or skill.

Devote time and attention to acquiring knowledge.
Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result.
A paid position of regular employment.
A current medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes.
The indefinite continued progress of existence and events.
A period of 24 hours.
The period of darkness in each 24 hours.
The period of time between midnight and noon, especially from sunrise to noon.
The period of time at the end of the day, usually from about 6 p.m. to bedtime.
On or during this present day.
On the day after today.
On the day before today.
A period of seven days.
A period of time corresponding approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases or to one twelfth of a year.
The time taken by the Earth to make one revolution around the sun.

Not existing before; recently made, invented, or discovered.
In an early stage of life or development.
To be desired or approved of.

Pleasing to the senses or mind aesthetically.
Unpleasant or repulsive in appearance.

Moving or operating, or designed to move or operate, at a low speed.

Making little or no noise.

With little or no light.

Not open; shut.
At or to a short distance away; close.

Coming before all others in time or order; 1st.
Coming after all others in time or order; final.

Used before a word beginning with a vowel sound.
Used to refer to specific nouns.
